Qualifiers.Scope: Regulations governing the physical location (siting) of noise-producing equipment on a property.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to all service equipment, including but not limited to pool equipment, air conditioning units, and generators. Also applies to the replacement of existing equipment.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: No explicit exclusions of equipment types are mentioned. However, a waiver process exists for the housing/insulation requirement.

Dimensional.name: equipment_location
Dimensional.description: The designated yard or area where the equipment is placed.

Dimensional.name: street_side_yard_encroachment
Dimensional.description: The distance equipment may encroach into a street-side yard.

Dimensional.name: driveway_clearance
Dimensional.description: Minimum clear distance required for a driveway, as shown in an example.

Material.name: equipment_enclosure
Material.description: Requirement for equipment to be housed and insulated.

Environmental.name: noise_compliance_method
Environmental.description: Method used to ensure compliance with the City's Noise Ordinance when a waiver for housing is sought.

Usage.name: installation_type
Usage.description: Whether the installation is new or a replacement.

Standards.name: noise_ordinance
Standards.value: City’s Noise Ordinance in Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code

Procedures.name: waiver_for_housing_insulation
Procedures.value: The Planning Department can waive the housing/insulation requirement if specific conditions are met.

Mandatory: All service equipment must meet the City’s Noise Ordinance (Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code).
Equipment may not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards.
Equipment must be insulated and housed (subject to waiver exception).
Optional: Equipment may encroach into a street-side yard.
Conditional: IF equipment is a replacement, THEN it shall conform to this section IF it is feasible. (Ambiguous Language: 'where feasible' is subjective and not defined).

IF the housing/insulation requirement is to be waived, THEN the equipment must be located in the buildable area AND a combination of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening/buffering must assure compliance with the Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line.
IF equipment encroaches into the street-side yard, THEN the encroachment must be a maximum of 6 feet.

Exceptions.Placement: While equipment is generally prohibited from yards, it may be located in a street-side yard, encroaching up to 6 feet.
Exceptions.Enclosure: The requirement for equipment to be insulated and housed can be waived by the Planning Department under specific conditions related to location and alternative noise mitigation.

Relationships.Hierarchical: The 'General rules' are the primary regulations that apply to all specific equipment types (Pool, AC, Generator) shown in the examples (Figures A, B, C).
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Compliance with the siting rules (e.g., waiver for housing) is dependent on demonstrating compliance with the separate City's Noise Ordinance.
